intro: Eschweileria insignis, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, giving it its common name. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Eschweileria insignis is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
